Executed when this view is displayed (added to the DOM). This method is called from the view binding when rendering this view's template is complete and added to the DOM. This should be overridden by inheritting classes and should primarily be used for 'on-display' funcitonality such as certain event handlers

// ---------------------------------------- // Javascript // ---------------------------------------- var DogView = Falcon.View.extend({ url: '#dog_view', display: function() { console.log("Dog View Displayed") } }); var view_model = { showing_dog_view: ko.observable(false), my_dog_view: new DogView() }; console.log("Initializing"); setTimeout(function() { view_model.show_dog_view(true) }, 5000); Falcon.apply(view_model, '#application'); // ---------------------------------------- // HTML // ----------------------------------------
// ---------------------------------------- // Console // ---------------------------------------- ... my_dog_view is currently not rendered because showing_dog_view is set to false => Initializing ... Waits five seconds and then sets show_dog_view to true, my_dog_view is then rendered on the screen => Dog View Displayed
